and authorized at an annual or special meeting of stockholders and not by written consent by the affirmative
vote of at least 66 2⁄3 of the outstanding voting stock which is not owned by the interested stockholder.

column1: Generally a business combination includes a merger asset or stock sale or other transaction resulting in a financial benefit to the
interested stockholder. An interested stockholder is a person who owns 15 or more of a corporation’s outstanding voting
securities or is an affiliate or associate of the corporation and within three years prior to the determination of interested stockholder
status did own 15 or more of a corporation’s outstanding voting securities and affiliates and associates of such person. The
existence of this provision may have an anti-takeover effect with respect to transactions our oard of Directors does not approve in
advance. Section 203 may also discourage attempts that might result in a premium over the market price for the shares of capital

column2: Our Class C Capital Stock and Class A Common Stock are listed on The NASDAQ Global Select Market under the symbols

column1: “GOOG” and “GOOGL” respectively. Our Class  Common Stock is not listed on any stock market or exchange.
